channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Gunman argued with mum before attack
item.description: The five victims, including a father and daughter out walking their dog, were killed in Plymouth.

item.title: Boy, five, was hotel window fall victim
item.description: The boy's death at a hotel in the city centre is not being treated as suspicious, police say.

item.title: Prison guard demanded sexual favours from inmates
item.description: David Whitfield is convicted of misconduct over the illicit activity with 12 women over five years.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Hiker's ashes to be spread in places she loved
item.description: Esther Dingley's remains were found by her boyfriend nine months after she vanished in the Pyrenees.

item.title: Woman denies killing son by not managing his asthma
item.description: Laura Heath also denies child cruelty charges following the death of her boy Hakeem Hussain, seven.

item.title: Eileen Barrott murder: Husband detained in Scotland
item.description: Police have been searching for 54-year-old Mark Barrott since Mrs Barrott's death on Sunday.

item.title: Queen Cynethryth's 'lost' monastery found next to Cookham church
item.description: Archaeologists from the University of Reading solve a mystery that has long puzzled historians.

item.title: George Floyd: Torquay officer warned over offensive meme
item.description: Sgt Geraint Jones admitted gross misconduct and has been given a final written warning.

item.title: New investigation into rapist paramedic
item.description: Andrew Wheeler, who raped a patient in her own home, is serving a 21-year jail term for sex attacks.

item.title: Camden barbecue shooting: Three arrests made
item.description: Two teenage boys and a 22-year-old man are arrested after a shooting at a crowded communal barbecue.

item.title: Afghanistan: Mum of killed soldier defends troops' legacy
item.description: Lee Mackie says her son, who died in 2009, helped give respite to Afghans from the Taliban regime.

item.title: Cambridgeshire: Train driver injured in level crossing collision
item.description: The freight train's driver suffered minor injuries as it collided with a tractor, Network Rail says.

item.title: Plasma donor meets children helped by donations
item.description: A donor from Coventry meets a family from Nottingham whose children who were saved by plasma.

item.title: Pub car park 'rifle' arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: West Midlands boxers reflect on Olympic Games
item.description: The three boxers from the West Midlands have fond memories of their time in Tokyo and medal wins.

item.title: Covid: 'I'm pregnant, should I have the vaccine?'
item.description: Many pregnant women have declined the Covid jab, but what's best for the baby?

item.title: Portrait artist captures Southampton's homeless community
item.description: Artist James Earley uses his work to raise awareness of homelessness and money for charity.

item.title: Azeem Rafiq: Yorkshire admit ex-player was 'victim of inappropriate behaviour'
item.description: Yorkshire admit former player Azeem Rafiq was "the victim of inappropriate behaviour" and offer him their "profound apologies".

item.title: Super League: Warrington v Catalans postponed because of Covid-19 cases in Dragons camp
item.description: Thursday's Super League game between Warrington and Catalans is postponed because of four of the Dragons' "essential staff" catching Covid-19.

item.title: Enfield Town: WWE's NXT UK teams up with seventh-tier club
item.description: Expect some top-rope action at Enfield Town this season, as the non-league side partner with WWE's NXT UK.
